title: Boris Johnson news live: Latest Brexit updates as parliament suspended
text:
Boris Johnson lost his second bid for a snap general election and was accused of “grotesque cowardice” amid angry scenes in the Commons before parliament was suspended for five weeks.

Some members of the opposition held signs bearing the word “silenced” and chanted “shame on you” at the prime minister. A small group of MPs attempted to pin speaker John Bercow to his chair to stop him leaving.

It comes as Conservative rebel Oliver Letwin said he was now backing a second Brexit referendum – and claimed there was “an increasing number" of Tory MPs now ready to deliver a majority for another public vote.
